Yes, the best time to visit Yellowstone National Park and see its geysers is from April to May or from September to November. During these months, the temperatures are cooler, the crowds have thinned out, and the wildlife is more active.

Here are some details about the best times to visit Yellowstone National Park:

1. April to May: During this time, the park is just emerging from winter, and the waterfalls are at their peak. The crowds are considerably smaller than during the summer months, and the wildlife is more active. However, some of the park's facilities are yet to open.

2. September to November: Autumn is the time when the park's trees put on a beautiful display of fall colors. The elk and other wildlife are also more active during this time. The temperatures are cooler, and there are fewer visitors. Some of the park's services start shutting down by mid-October, and winter conditions start to set in.

However, if you're keen on seeing the geysers, the best time to go would be in the late spring or early summer, around June or July. During this time, the park is at its busiest, and the temperatures can get warm. Keep in mind that the number of visitors can make parking and other activities challenging, and also the weather around the geysers can be unpredictable.

Ultimately, the best time for you to visit Yellowstone National Park and see its geysers depends on your preferences and travel plans. Whatever the months you choose, ensure to check weather conditions and park regulations beforehand.
